description.narrative: By 2016, national partners have the capacity to generate and use information and knowledge and evidence to inform child sensitive social policies and budgets., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Knowledge on the situation and rights of children among stakeholders and duty â€“bearers generated to guide implementation of CRC, policy formulation, social sectors' strategies and budget allocations for increased social spending on national programmes that improve realization of the rights of children within the lowest wealth quintile.

sector.narrative: Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
